label: 福田
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: This is a Buddhist expression.  Just as good crops are the reward for cultivating fields, so happiness is the reward for cultivating virtue.  [For instance, fukuden, or] the limits of virtuous conduct [could be] increased by granting a general amnesty (taisha).  [In such cases, p]rayers were...offered for the prosperity of the nation (A: p. 210). [大赦]
